Upslope's BACKCountry Tap Room

Join us for the long-awaited 10th annual Upslope's Backcountry Tap Room, Upslope's hike to a pop-up tap room experience for brews and views, on Saturday, September 13, 2025 at Winter Park Resort!


Tickets on sale now. Optional sandwich add - on available. Gluten - free and vegan options.

*Rain or shine, Upslope's Backcountry Tap Room tickets are non refundable, plan ahead for weather and come prepared!

Presented by Rendezvous
Benefiting The National Sports Center for the Disabled (NSCD)

You know what pairs well with award-winning wine from around the world? Top-tier Rocky Mountain views. Join us on September 20 for a trailside wine festival, featuring unlimited wine samples, live music, and more all benefitting the National Sports Center for the Disabled (NSCD).

Everest on September 27, 2025!
Elevation Everest is a race series held at Winter Park Resort in Colorado that offers hiking/trail running events centered around one goal: elevation gain.

Choose to race solo or make a relay team to divide and conquer the total elevation gain. Athletes race up the mountain, ride down the Gondola, and do it all again until the summit. Celebrate together at Base Camp in between laps and after you cross the finish line with DJ's, saunas & cold plunges, activities, and more.","timeZoneServerOffset":-1,"hasButtonCtaText":false,"buttonCtaText":"","name":"Elevation Everest"}]

Winter Park Competition Center
Established in 1962 as the
Winter Park Ski Club
, the
Winter Park Competition Center
stands as a hallmark of mountain sports heritage and one of the region's oldest clubs, pioneering in
Alpine
,
Freestyle
, and
Nordic
competitions.
Today, it offers top-tier
ski
,
snowboard
, and
mountain bike programs
across a wide range of training and competitive specializations, aiming to enhance skills and nurture
elite athletes
within a vibrant community of enthusiasts. At its heart, the Competition Center prioritizes athletic and personal growth, backed by world-class coaches and staff committed to
integrity
,
excellence
,
team
and
fun
.
For detailed information on our
winter and summer programs
,
full-time academy
,
sports performance program
,
events
,
volunteering opportunities
, and more, please explore the links below.

carousel-component

About Winter Park resort®
Winter Park Resort
Who We Are
Winter Park is the closest major mountain destination to Denver at just 67 miles away. Don’t be fooled by our convenient location, though… you’ll feel remotely tucked away in our high country corner of the Rockies. With easy access to 765,000 acres of public land, Winter Park is home to endless adventures and an unparalleled and unfiltered Colorado experience.
Learn More
Community Profile
The Towns of Winter Park and Fraser, located in Grand County, Colorado, are situated in a high mountain park at elevations of 9,000 ft. and 8,800 ft. respectively. The valley is surrounded by the Arapaho National Forest and three wilderness areas.
Learn More
Partners
These businesses and organizations are instrumental in allowing our guests the opportunity to Create the Best Memories, Again and Again.
Learn More
Resort Amenities & Services
See what Winter Park has to offer with everything from public ski storage to on-mountain photography.
Learn More
ABOUT ALTERRA MOUNTAIN COMPANY
Alterra Mountain Company is a community of 12 iconic year-round destinations, including North America’s leading heli-ski operation. The company owns and operates a range of recreation, hospitality, real-estate development, food and beverage and retail businesses. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado with destinations across the continent, we are rooted in the spirit of the mountains and united by a passion for outdoor adventure. Alterra Mountain Company’s family of diverse playgrounds spans five U.S. states and three Canadian provinces. We honor each destination’s unique character and authenticity and celebrate the legendary adventures and enduring memories they bring to everyone.
Learn More
Contact Us
Need to get in touch? Give us a call or email us so we can contact you.
Learn More

Media Center
Winter Park Resort Media Center
This contact information is for media inquiries only. If you are looking for general information about the resort or other services, please email

or call 970.726.5514.

rich-text, responsive-table
About Winter Park
Winter Park Resort is home to endless mountain adventure, from finding solitude on a 12,000-foot snow-covered peak, to sharing ear-to-ear grins with your favorite people on the tubing hill, to pushing through your thigh-burn for one more minute to get a prime spot for après. As Colorado's longest continuously operating ski resort, Winter Park Resort has been welcoming adventures and mountain enthusiasts for more than 80 years. Here are some of the reasons why:
Winter Park by the numbers
- Winter Park is one of the largest ski resorts in Colorado with varied terrain for all abilities.
View our Mountain Stats.
Winter Park's lay of the land
- In an effort to save resources, we switched to digital trail maps that you can find here or on our app.
View our digital maps.
Download the Winter Park App.
A history of trailblazing
- Did you know that modern-day trail grooming got its start right here in Winter Park?
Find out more about Winter Park's unlikely past.
People, Planet, Community
- We take our responsibility as a leader in Colorado and in the mountain resort seriously. Learn more about what we're doing to keep our business inclusive, sustainable, and local.
View our community commitment.
Connection, Reflection, and Action
- Winter Park Resort has been doing important work with Native and Indigenous People. Learn more about our relationships and our inherent connection to the land and water.
Land
Acknowledgement
.

Winter Park x Amtrak 2024
Tickets for the Winter Park Express - the "ski train" between Denver and the base of the slopes at Winter Park Resort - are now on sale for the 2024 season. Follow the link below to read more.
Read Press Released
Snow On the Ground
Winter Park Resort Partners with Native Skiers and Artists to Honor our Connection to Snow, Water, and Land. Winter Park Resort has unveiled a new art installation in partnership with Native and Indigenous artists, skiers, riders, and outdoor stewards. The project was developed after four years of discussions, designs, and collaboration on ways to raise awareness of Winter Park’s sense of place, original Native and Indigenous heritage, and snow’s vital importance that extends far beyond recreation.
Read Press Release
Conifer Commons, New Employee Housing is Complete.
Winter Park completed construction on its workforce housing complex and residents have moved in. Conifer Commons provides 330+ beds in private, lockable units for Winter Park employees.
View details
Development Plan Updates
Read our statement about our recently submitted base-area preliminary development plan (PDP) to the Town of Winter Park.

Image Gallary
We are providing select photos, images and videos of Winter Park Resort. These assets are protected by U.S. copyright and are intended for use by members of the news or for educational purposes. Any other use is not allowed. For any authorized use, please credit Winter Park Resort.

Downloadable Photo Gallery
Download Photos
Visiting Media
Winter Park Resort welcome media representatives on assignment and is happy to help coordinate your visit. Upon approval and based on availability, we can provide complimentary products, including lift tickets, rental equipment, lessons, etc. during your visit. We ask that visiting media make requests at least 30 days in advance. We may not be able to accommodate last-minute requests, and we may decline any request for any reason. We will evaluate on a case-by-case basis any requests for additional guests or journalist on vacation.
Our top priority is to provide the best guest experience for everyone who visits Winter Park Resort. Therefore, we limit complimentary or discounted media visits during peak periods, including Thanksgiving, the Christmas and New Year's holidays and the week in between, MLK weekend, President's Day weekend, and select weeks in March because of Spring Break. In special cases, we will do our best to accommodate media requests during peak times, but ask that visiting media do their best to come during off peak times.
